summary:
During my two years with Delta Electronic Europe, I was responsible for recruitment which involved interviewing many candidates in different European countries. I was also responsible for keeping in close contact with colleagues in differing countries in order to ensure projects and activities were being completed satisfactorily. I was also involved in other large and small HR projects including compiling job descriptions and the relevant job grades. Furthermore, I was the main contact in helping employees who were expatriated to the Netherlands in their relocation process. It was an interesting and valuable experience to be with Taiwanese company as it develops its growing business in Europe. 

In my years with Unilever Bestfoods Europe Business Group, I was in charge of coordinating different projects which involved more than 20 European units. The projects consisted of implementing the Unilever Global People Survey, a 360 degree performance feedback system, and “Coaching for Results”, a training program for 100 key managers within UBFE. I was also responsible for different internal HR administration processes, which included salary reviews and share options, and for the user interface of an HR information system.

In my previous work experience, both as a Training Manager with Unilever Taiwan and as an HR Manager with Eli Lilly Taiwan, I managed varying compensation, recruitment and internal employee training programs.

My work experiences have provided me with a good knowledge and understanding of the HR function within both local and multinational companies.  I find that working with a multinational company suits me as I have lived in 3 different countries and accumulated a strong and sound knowledge of different languages and cultures. 

My strengths are:
- Project management.
- Coordination and liaison among different parties
- Management of training programs
- Recruitment
- Use of HR IT systems.

volunteer_experiences.description: As a class mother, I was the coordinator for the activities in the class and also the member in the school committee in helping organizing all kinds of activities such as Sinterklaas and Christmas celebrations and sport events. One of the most important tasks was to keep good contact and communication with other parents in order to help mobilize them to be more involved in school matters.

As a volunteer I am required to work at least 4 hours a week to help the cinema operating smoothly. The Filmtheater Hilversum is managed by a foundation. The tasks of my volunteer work including selling tickets, attending the bar and any other activities requiring the attention of the personnel during shifts. I did this between Oct 2010 till end 2011. It is great to be back to this role.
